abstract: Phil Mickelson did not trade in shares of Clorox as Carl C. Icahn was mounting a takeover bid in 2011, say four people briefed on the matter. He is still under investigation over trades in Dean Foods.
snippet: Phil Mickelson did not trade in shares of Clorox as Carl C. Icahn was mounting a takeover bid in 2011, say four people briefed on the matter. He is still under investigation over trades in Dean Foods.
lead_paragraph: Phil Mickelson, the famed golfer, did not trade in the shares of Clorox just as the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn was mounting an unsolicited takeover bid for the company in 2011, say four people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: Golfer Mickelson’s Role Said to Be Overstated in Insider Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Golfer’s Role in Trading Said to Be Overstated

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Ben Protess

abstract: Phil Mickelson did not trade in shares of Clorox as Carl C. Icahn was mounting a takeover bid for the company in 2011. | For Goldman, Alibaba is a symbol of what could have been. | Goldman and Bain Capital agreed to end a lawsuit involving the “club deal.” | Hillshire’s conundrum.
snippet: Phil Mickelson did not trade in shares of Clorox as Carl C. Icahn was mounting a takeover bid for the company in 2011. | For Goldman, Alibaba is a symbol of what could have been. | Goldman and Bain Capital agreed to end a lawsuit involving the “cl...
lead_paragraph: MICKELSON’S ROLE OVERSTATED IN INSIDER INQUIRY  |  The golfer Phil Mickelson did not trade in the shares of Clorox as the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn was mounting a takeover bid for the company in 2011, according to people briefed on the matter, Matthew Goldstein and Ben Protess write in DealBook. Recent news reports said that Clorox was among the stocks that federal authorities were examining as part of a two-year investigation into well-timed trades made by Mr. Mickelson and the gambler William T. Walters.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Mickelson Not Linked to Clorox
